Defect.refObjectName: Make log level configurable from outside of the Ingestion Service package
Defect.Description:
Since operatiors will be deploying already prepared IS packages from time to time they would need to change Log Level for issues traceability. Currently logback.xml has the log level embedded in it. That needs to be externalized.

AC:

Documentation needs to be updated.
Defect.Name: Make log level configurable from outside of the Ingestion Service package
Defect.Notes: OlegK update: Team has decided to implement the feature by adding a property to sli.property that would control a logging level for the "org.slc.sli.ingestion" package.
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Operators deploying already prepared ingestion service packages may need to change the Log Level for issue traceability. Currently logback.xml has the log level embedded in it and can't be configured by the operator.

Defect.refObjectName: Update production dev account welcome email text to include link to documentation.
Defect.Description: Update production dev account welcome email text to include link to documentation.
Defect.Name: Update production dev account welcome email text to include link to documentation.

Task.refObjectName: update runbooks and op release notes

Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription:
Operator steps:

1. Add a property to the admin app's config.yml.  This property needs to exist in both sandbox and production mode.

property:  app_dev_documentation_link

sandbox value

app_dev_documentation_link: http://dev.slcedu.org/getting-started/sandbox

production value

app_dev_documentation_link: http://dev.slcedu.org/getting-started/

Defect.refObjectName: Access to student list was not logged.
Defect.Description:
After linda.kim logged in, she wanted to see a student list from one of her sections (for example, "8th Grade English - Sec 6"), when the student list was displayed,  there was no "access to restricted entity" security event logged in audit.log. However, when she clicked a specific student in the list, when the detail info of the selected student displayed, the "access to restricted entity" security event was logged in audit.log.

The sample URL request is: "http://local.slidev.org:8888/dashboard/service/list/ceffbb26-1327-4313-9cfc-1c3afd38122e".

Some thoughts:
API calls are optimized to reduce the round trips from dashboard to data store, so the student list is assembled under the hood of API, which is why the current implementation could not catch this event. Further investigation is needed to identify the optimizations and make sure all events are caught in the optimization code.

based on the page: https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/REST+API+Design+Guidelines
We need to look closely into the following areas:
  1. Resources in Context

  2. Complex variations

    1. Projection and Views
    2. Dereferencing/Expansion

Risk Description: 
A user could access student PII data and this access would not be logged.  The likelihood of this risk is high because the SLI Dashboard loads a list of students.  The impact of this risk is low because the user must be authenticated and authorized to view the data; we are only missing a record of that access. Therefore the security severity is medium.
Defect.Name: Access to student list was not logged.
Defect.Notes:
from api viewpoint, there are two ways to query restricted entity info, such as student.
  1. v1/students/.....
  2. v1/entity/...../students

see Lincoln's email below for a full list of URLs supported by API.

The existing code handles case 1.

However, case 2 was missed. Because all case 2 urls call the following method in DefaultCrudEndpoint.java

public Response read(final String resourceName, final String key, final String value, final String idKey,
            final String resolutionResourceName, final HttpHeaders headers, final UriInfo uriInfo)

In this method we can check "resolutionResourceName", if the corresponding entity is restricted. we should log the access to the restricted entity.

Please check the attachment for the proposed the fix. We should have acceptance tests to cover all URLs belonging to case 2.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
From: Lincoln Dalgado <ldalgado@wgen.net>
Date: Monday, June 18, 2012 2:15 PM
To: Josh Wotman <jwotman@wgen.net>
Cc: Sliders-MegatronDev <Sliders-MegatronDev@wgen.net>
Subject: DE460 :: Requirement Clarification

https://rally1.rallydev.com/#/4314775983d/detail/defect/6416107029
 
Hi Josh
As resolution of DE460, we are planning to log security events when an API user seeks any of the below highlighted URLs.
Acceptance tests will be created to confirm that there is a securityEvent in the mongo securityEvent collection for every request of below type.
If the acceptance criteria requires more checks, please let us know.
 
Thanks
 
v1/studentCompetencies/{studentCompetencyId}
v1/studentCompetencies/{studentCompetencyId}/reportCards

v1/attendances/{attendanceId}

pbackes - Need complete understanding of what data needs to be logged (student was done at the suggestion of Lucky Strike).  What about parent or other data?  Also need to deal with 'view' access to data.  Is this really a P2 and needed for Alpha?
JW. Yes, it's needed for Alpha.   And, as per security office, only student data for Alpha.
 
pbackes - 6/7/12 - Priority being considered again.  Waiting for PO/Security Office to make a call.

[DC] Email from Josh on 6/7
From:Josh Wotman <jwotman@wgen.net>

Josh
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Under certain circumstances, the audit log does not capture a teacher's access to a related student's personally identifiable information.

Defect.refObjectName: Any user from SLC hosted directory can upload files to landing zone
Defect.Description:
SLI stores users from two different applications, the simple IDP and the ingestion SFTP endpoint, in the same LDAP system.  Permission to ingest files and connect to the SFTP endpoint is represented by group membership in LDAP.  However this permission does not appear to be enforced for authenticating and uploading files.  

Proof of Concept/Repro Steps
I registered a developer user and authenticated to the SFTP endpoint.  I then disconnected and had Justin Kreger remove the ingestion group membership from my user.  I then authenticated/connected to the SFTP endpoint and uploaded a few files.  I was able to upload control and xml files that the ingestion process attempted to process (but did not due to some errors in the data).   I was also able to delete files.

We believe based on this test that any user in the LDAP system could authenticate to the SFTP endpoint and upload or delete files (in the landing zone/directories they have access to.)  

A malicious user could abuse this scenario by uploading files with malicious content (malware/virus) that other users could then download and open, by uploading corrupt data that will be ingested, by deleting files in the landing zone, or by learning sensitive information contained in files left in the landing zone.  

The likelihood of this risk is medium because the attack requires no special skills or knowledge, howevever the attacker must have access to the specific directory/landing zone to be attacked and must have an account on the SLI hosted directory/LDAP.  The impact of this risk is high due to the potential exposure of sensitive data left in the landing zone.  The overall security severity is medium-high (and therefore a P2 defect.)

Recommendation
Users that are not authorized for ingestion should not be able to access (upload, view, delete) files in the landing zone.  This could be achieved by storing ingestion users in a separate LDAP "ou" or a separate LDAP server altogether (although either option requires some duplication.)  The SFTP endpoint would then authenticate against this separate "ou" or seprate LDAP server.  

(There are certainly other ways to resolve this defect as well.  For example, we could make some big changes so that users upload files for ingestion via a web app and then have the web app enforce ingestion permissions.  This is only used as an example to illustrate that there may be other ways to resolve this defect than the recommendation above.)
Defect.Name: Any user from SLC hosted directory can upload files to landing zone
Defect.Notes:
This is probably related to (or caused by) DE1134:  https://rally1.rallydev.com/#/4314775983d/detail/defect/6924041755


RF:  Fix verified in RC.  
1) Created new sandbox developer.  Provisioned landing zone.  SFTP in and ingest data.   
2) SLC Op disables account.  Developer can no longer SFTP into landing zone.
3) SLC Op re-enables account.  Developer can login via SFTP.

Fix follows DE1134's recommendation: renamed Ingestion User LDAP group to ingestion_user and have pam enforce group membership for ldap logins.

Task.refObjectName: modify RC to support and verify in RC

Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription:
Operator migration:

1. Rename the LDAP groups "Ingestion User" and "Application Developer" groups


In LDAP, rename "<ldap_base>,ou=SLIAdmin,ou=groups,cn=Ingestion User"   to "<ldap_base>,ou=SLIAdmin,ou=groups,cn=ingestion_user"

In LDAP, rename "<ldap_base>,ou=SLIAdmin,ou=groups,cn=Application Developer"   to "<ldap_base>,ou=SLIAdmin,ou=groups,cn=application_developer"


2. On all Landing Zone hosts (SFTP servers), create a file /etc/proftpd.allowed.group that contains the group "ingestion_user"

3. On all Landing Zone hosts (SFTP servers), update the PAM configuration to enforce group membership for SFTP logins.


Change /etc/pam.d/ldap-auth to include the following line as the first "auth" directive

auth       required      pam_listfile.so onerr=fail item=group sense=allow file=/etc/proftpd.allowed.group

Defect.Description:
Neither API nor Ingestion applications are setup properly to rotate their log files. This leads to the log files growing unbounded, which results in stability issues in CI and operations headaches for production environments. The logging configuration should have default settings to support sane log file rotation.
 
Note - This includes all system log files - including logs for Ruby Apps.
Defect.Name: System log file rotation
Defect.Notes:
Pointing this on 5/21 and will do all that B Holdsworth requires for UAT ASAP

6/21: Added US2927 to create a Ruby Gem in PI5
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: By default, no policy is applied to manage log file rotation.

Defect.refObjectName: NullPointerException in findTenantIdByLzPath causes ingestion job to fail when zip files are dropped in an lz with a soft linked path
Defect.Description:
The Hermod environment has its landing zone path configured and soft linked in the following problematic way for zipfiles:

[root@nxmaestro inbound]# ls -l /home
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 13 Jun  4 11:28 /home -> /storage/home

[root@nxmaestro inbound]# grep landingzone.inbounddir /opt/tomcat/conf/sli.properties
landingzone.inbounddir = /home/ingestion/lz/inbound

This results in the tenant collection to have entries like this:
[root@nxmaestro inbound]# mongo sli
MongoDB shell version: 2.0.6
connecting to: sli
mongos> db.tenant.findOne()
{
        "_id" : "2012dt-0c693360-cf5b-11e1-a647-024224a39f1b",
        "type" : "tenant",
        "padding" : "                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            ",
        "body" : {
                "tenantId" : "Hyrule",
                "landingZone" : [
                        {
                                "ingestionServer" : "nxmaestro",
                                "educationOrganization" : "NYC",
                                "desc" : "Landing zone for Hyrule-NYC",
                                "path" : "/home/ingestion/lz/inbound/Hyrule-NYC"
                        }
                ]
        },
        "metaData" : {
                "updated" : ISODate("2012-07-16T15:29:35.502Z"),
                "created" : ISODate("2012-07-16T15:29:35.502Z")
        }
}

However, when dropping a zip file a query is done with the real path (not soft linked) caused the tenant lookup to fail as identified by Dani below.

[7/18/2012 12:19:45 AM] Danilo Duran: yes but why did it fail? seems to be a problem determining the tenant from the landingzone
[7/18/2012 12:36:21 AM] Danilo Duran: ok im trying to capture the tenant query that returns no results and blows up the universe.. i bet the lz path in it is "wrong"
[7/18/2012 12:39:41 AM] Danilo Duran: aha! called it. here's the problem with tenant/landingzone
[7/18/2012 12:40:10 AM] Danilo Duran: the query we issue to get the tenantId from the lz path:
[7/18/2012 12:40:14 AM] Danilo Duran: { "ts" : ISODate("2012-07-18T04:37:30.517Z"), "op" : "query", "ns" : "sli.tenant", "query" : { "body.landingZone.path" : "/storage/home/ingestion/lz/inbound/Midgar-DAYBREAK" }, "ntoreturn" : 1, "responseLength" : 20, "millis" : 0, "client" : "10.159.6.202", "user" : "" }
[7/18/2012 12:40:38 AM] Danilo Duran: have we recently change the mount point for nxmaestro?
[7/18/2012 12:41:01 AM] Danilo Duran: the sli tenant collection does not contain the "/storage/" prefix
[7/18/2012 12:41:44 AM] Brandon Suzuki: That query is only issued during zip file processing?
[7/18/2012 12:41:44 AM] Brandon Suzuki: That query is only issued during zip file processing?
[7/18/2012 12:49:56 AM] Danilo Duran: i will manually change the tenant collection in hermod to have /storage/
[7/18/2012 12:51:53 AM] Brandon Suzuki: I've copied the xml files then ctl in previous runs.
[7/18/2012 12:52:02 AM] Brandon Suzuki: So that is also an option potentially.
[7/18/2012 12:52:16 AM] Danilo Duran: i'd like to be sure we can ingest a zip file but yeah we can always fall back
[7/18/2012 12:52:24 AM] Brandon Suzuki: Yah, sounds good.
[7/18/2012 1:09:58 AM] Danilo Duran: ok with my update to the tenant collection, 25M zip got past that fail point
[7/18/2012 1:10:11 AM] Danilo Duran: now it seems to be doing md5
[7/18/2012 1:10:39 AM] Danilo Duran: (another thing we should be milking our 8 cores to do)

This results in the following exception causing the job to fail:

18 Jul 2012 00:06:00.271-0400 INFO  [Camel (camel-1) thread #15 - file:///home/ingestion/lz/inbound/Midgar-DAYBREAK] CamelRouting [NO_USER] - No errors in zip file. Routing to ControlFilePreProcessor.
18 Jul 2012 00:06:00.610-0400 ERROR [Camel (camel-1) thread #15 - file:///home/ingestion/lz/inbound/Midgar-DAYBREAK] o.s.s.i.p.ControlFilePreProcessor [NO_USER] - Error processing batch job DE1113_25M.zip-c7cd049a-5a33-445f-b9c0-739f4a5b
3ed5
java.lang.NullPointerException: null
        at org.slc.sli.ingestion.tenant.TenantMongoDA.findTenantIdByLzPath(TenantMongoDA.java:114) ~[ingestion-core-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]
        at org.slc.sli.ingestion.tenant.TenantMongoDA.getTenantId(TenantMongoDA.java:60) ~[ingestion-core-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]
        at org.slc.sli.ingestion.processors.ControlFilePreProcessor.setTenantIdFromDb(ControlFilePreProcessor.java:278) [ingestion-core-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]
        at org.slc.sli.ingestion.processors.ControlFilePreProcessor.parseControlFile(ControlFilePreProcessor.java:200) [ingestion-core-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]
        at org.slc.sli.ingestion.processors.ControlFilePreProcessor.processUsingNewBatchJob(ControlFilePreProcessor.java:123) [ingestion-core-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]

This should at least be documented so operators know this is an invalid configuration.
Defect.Name: Ingestion job fails when zip files are dropped in an lz with a soft linked path
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Operators should not have dynamic links in configuration parameters. Ingestion job to fails when ZIP files are placed in an landing zone with a soft-linked path. This is an invalid configuration. Any queries done with the real path afterward will produce errors.

Defect.Description: Need to migrate StudentSectionGradebookEntry data in Omni Sndbox to the new collection "StudentGradebookEntry".
Defect.Name: Migrate StudentSectionGradebookEntry to StudentGradebookEntry
Defect.Notes:
We have solution in place.
We created a script that iterates through studentSectionGradebookEntry and reinserts the records with updated "type" field to studentGradebookEntry collection.

Its a very simple script and would solve the problem.

RC testing in progress.
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription:
This script migrates data from StudentSectionGradebookEntry to StudentGradebookEntry.

How to run the script:

1.) chmod +x /sli/opstools/migration/collection_migration

2.) ./collection_migration <DATABASE> <SERVER>:<MONGO_PORT> studentSectionGradebookEntry studentGradebookEntry
